column4: Ubuntu can't seem to detect my wireless card, anyone can help?
Ubuntu can't seem to detect my wireless card, anyone can help?
whats the card
put lspci and look for the exact name givin for your wifi card
my wireless card isn't detected how will it show in lspci?
just try it first ;)
i did that, didn't show. Only showed my Wired connection
can you find out what the card is.. is it in a laptop or tower pci card??
its a built in wifi card because its a laptop
was there any output in lspci that showed 802.11b/g or anything like that
nope.
ok, then lets start by giving me the model of the laptop, or if you have an existing win install on the lappy then you could find out what the card is from there
its Intel(R) Pro/Wireless LAN 2100 3B Mini PCI Adapter
ok :)
u talking to me right?
look here http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?p=2540798 sorry about that :)
haha ok thnx i'll look up.
your card is working according to these ppl so stick with that
okies
i tried the help from the site u gave me, and iwconfig shows that there isn't any wireless connection
which part did you get to
the iwconfig to check on the wireless. But it says, No Wireless Extensions
oh wait...
